results.title: Memories of Moomba
results.brief_description: A selection of short films made in a Digital Storytelling workshop held to celebrate 50 years ofthe Moomba festival. The stories explore the history of the parade and life as a sun queen of moomba. It traces the history of the well known carnival family, and highlights the achievements of the key figures involved in the wild and wacky water events. Memories of Moomba was produced in collaboration with City of Melbourne and Melbourne Moomba Waterfest.

results.title: TV news
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Media Probes”.
John Cameron Swayze, US television’s first national anchorman, examines how the drive for ratings has led to some dazzling newsroom packages. Highlights the notion of style in TV news programs and the image of the network for the audience, while touching briefly on the limitations of television as a news medium. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Design
results.creator_credit: Kit Laybourne, Mickey Lemle and Time-Life Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Media Probes”.
This film considers various aspects of design. Fashion designer Bill Blass shows how clothes make a statement about the people wearing them and a graphic designer and two production assistants point out the tricks of the trade. The final segment shows how a national motel chain set out to change its corporate logo and then rejected the new image. Hosted by Bill Blass, photographed by Ed Lynch and written by Tony Kahn and Brad Kesden.

results.title: Soap operas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Media Probes”.
Takes the viewer behind the scenes to witness the production process that yields a daily television serial. In this case the American Broadcasting Commission’s ‘All My Children’. Examines the unique relationship that exists between some 35 million soap opera watchers and their favourite serials. Considers what is involved in the writing of the scripts. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Political spots
results.creator_credit: Alan Goldberg, Mickey Lemle, WQED, Lemle and Laybourne
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Media Probes”.
Political advertising revealed as an elaborate form of product packaging: in the absence of meaningful debate, image is paramount. Discusses the role of television advertising. Examples are shown and discussed with the producers. Also examines the function of opinion polling in determining media strategies. Elementary guide to the reading of TV political promo spots. Also discusses the fact that two-thirds of campaigning funds are spent on television advertising. (16mm print is kinescope transfer from video original.)

results.title: Blood and circulation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanics of Life”.
Uses x-ray photography and animation to describe how the human blood system is designed. Shows the composition of blood through microphotography, and discusses the role of each blood component.

results.title: Shape description. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanical Drawing”.
This film is designed as a sequel to “Shape description part 1” which presented the theory of orthographic projection. In part 2, the step-by-step procedure of constructing a drawing is demonstrated, and reasons for each step are explained.

results.title: Shop procedures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanical Drawing”.
This film shows how finished drawings are used as detailed instructions in every step of manufacturing. From the drafting room the drawings are seen going to the blue-printing machine to the reproduced by the dozens or hundreds and distributed to all those workmen who will have a part in making the finished project, The film then shows many of these workmen at their jobs using blueprints in the pattern-making assembly shop, the foundry, the forging shop, and the assembly room.
